channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2023110484
item.description:
Report X-2023110484

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: BROCKTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found improperly loaded on van 420253 by manager. Box was on top shelf on its side resulting in the caps beginning to leak in box. Minimal contents spilled. Manager placed HAZMAT in red bucket and brought it to HAZMAT cage for evaluation. DescribePack: Loose caps on 2 bottles, no dmg to contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in red HAZMAT bucket and brought to HAZMAT cage for containment.

item.title: Report E-2023110322
item.description:
Report E-2023110322

  • City: CANTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: (2) 5-G pails of paint were crushed and leaking due to no dunnage used and heavier freight being stacked on top of. (1) pt of the paint released. Spill contained and cleaned. All materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110556
item.description:
Report X-2023110556

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: SOUTH YARMOUTH
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in tail in belly of the trailer 808499 leaking under several NC that caused the cap of one of the hazmat bottles to pop off. Package was removed from trailer before being identified as a damaged hazmat. We then we isolated and processed it away from the unload. DescribePack: The package was leaking and whole side was dissolved under NC DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: just unloading in the belly

item.title: Report X-2023110552
item.description:
Report X-2023110552

  • City: BROCKTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the belly of Trailer 839034 with NC packages crushing it DescribePack: Package was crushed and caused leakage from caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Managers and QA personnel was alerted and packages were placed in Hazmat bins and secured in Hazmat Cage

item.title: Report E-2023110044
item.description:
Report E-2023110044

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: CHICOPEE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported there was a 1gal release of UN1993 KZ-5430-RD from a 5gal metal pail on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. Terminal personnel felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and proper PPE. (1) 20-gallon metal drum of product, Oil Dri, and PPE were staged as waste onsite and left for the terminal to Manage.

item.title: Report X-2023101497
item.description:
Report X-2023101497

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: W SPRINGFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING REWRAP (NO LEAK) PACKAGE WAS OPENED BY RESPONDER BECAUSE IT WAS WET FROM THE OUTSIDE. ITEMS INSIDE WERE METAL CONTAINERS WITH FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABELS ON THEM. UNDECLARED HAZMAT.
